chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo Escobar

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ricardo Escobar appeared by video.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin appeared by video for Ricardo Escobar.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Any cash bail on deposit to be returned to the remitter. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ricardo Escobar in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Ricardo Escobar.  Student Intern Abigail Doweiko under the supervision of prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/30/22 @ 1p
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on September 30, 2022, at 1:00 PM
